title: Saudi Aramco’s profit fell 73 percent as demand for oil shrank.
Delta Air Lines Bought an Oil Refinery. It Didn’t Go as Planned.
summary: Delta’s foray into oil refining illustrates some of the reasons the business was in trouble even before the pandemic.

title: Norwegian Taxis, Wirelessly Charging While They Wait for a Fare
summary: Electric Jaguars in Oslo, using tech from a former NASA architect, will soon be able to recharge on special pads embedded under the road.

title: Europe’s Big Oil Companies Are Turning Electric
summary: Under pressure from governments and investors, industry leaders like BP and Shell are accelerating their production of cleaner energy.

title: Trump’s Tariffs? Coronavirus? China’s Exports Are Surging Anyway
summary: Chinese companies account for a greater share of goods sold abroad, showing their tremendous strength despite mounting challenges.

title: Algerian Journalist Sentenced to 3 Years for Reporting on Protests
summary: The journalist Khaled Drareni was convicted after reporting on the Hirak protest movement, which forced the removal of the country’s longtime ruler, Abdelaziz Bouteflika, last year.

title: Russia Approves Coronavirus Vaccine Before Completing Tests
summary: The country became the first in the world to approve a possible vaccine against the virus, despite warnings from the global authorities against cutting corners.

title: For Belarus Leader, a Fading Aura of Invincibility
summary: Undermined by the pandemic and a deepening economic crisis, and surrounded by sycophants, Aleksandr Lukashenko badly miscalculated in the recent election.

title: Top General in Middle East Says U.S. Troop Levels Will Drop in Iraq and Syria
summary: The commander, Gen. Kenneth F. McKenzie Jr., said U.S. forces would continue to combat pockets of Islamic State fighters.

title: ‘This Is Unforgivable’: Anger Mounts Over Mauritius Oil Spill
summary: Islanders have joined together in an effort to contain an estimated 1,000 tons of fuel oil that leaked into the waters surrounding the picturesque nation off Africa’s eastern coast.

title: In Diplomatic Doubleheader, U.S. Seizes Iranian Fuel From Ships Headed to Venezuela
summary: The high-seas handover blocked two diplomatic adversaries from evading American economic sanctions. Iran denied it was its fuel.

title: No Longer Cowed, Belarus Has Message for Once-Mighty Dictator: ‘Go Away!’
summary: As even his base starts to desert him after protests over a rigged election were met with brutality, Aleksandr G. Lukashenko’s 26-year grip on power may be slipping.

title: As U.S. Schools Move to Reopen Despite Covid-19, Teachers Threaten to Strike
summary: Barack Obama and other Democrats denounced President Trump’s handling of the coronavirus crisis. North Korea said that floods, sanctions and the virus had hurt its economy.

title: Belarus Protests Test Limits of Lukashenko’s Brutal, One-Man Rule
summary: For 26 years, President Aleksandr Lukashenko has built a regime in his own eccentric, authoritarian image. Now he faces the greatest challenge yet to his hold on power.

title: Pandemic Drives Millions From Latin America’s Universities
summary: They were the first in their families to make it to college. But how do you study when you can’t afford to eat?
